subject: Technology
title: Alessandro Volta and the First Battery
description: Learn Alessandro Volta and the First Battery in one minute.

hook.text: The first battery was a stack of metal discs and wet cardboard. It changed civilization forever.

buildup.text: In 1800, Alessandro Volta stacked zinc and copper discs separated by brine-soaked cloth. Electricity flowed continuously.

discovery.text: For the first time, humans had a steady, reliable source of electric current, not just sparks from friction.

twist.text: Volta built the battery to win a scientific argument. His rival believed electricity came only from living things.

climax.text: Napoleon was so impressed he made Volta a count. The unit of electrical force, the volt, bears his name.

punchline.text: A scientific grudge match gave us the battery and the volt.

quiz.question: What is named after Alessandro Volta?
